alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 08 at 10:48PM CST until March 12 at 4:48AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Cooke and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated continued rain due to training storms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sherman, Gainesville, Whitesboro, Denison, Pottsboro, Collinsville, Bells, Callisburg, Knollwood, Dorchester, Lake Texoma, Eisenhower State Park, Randell Lake, Lake Kiowa, Valley Lake, Preston, Southmayd, Sadler, Oak Ridge and Walnut Bend.
